H0.text: A flow chart is the type of display that will best help a researcher working on a family genetics project organize information when tracing a particular trait back through several generations of her ancestors.

H1.text: Cycle diagram is the type of display that will best help a researcher working on a family genetics project trace a particular trait back through several generations of her ancestors.

H2.text: Pedigree chart is the type of display that best helps a researcher working on a family genetics project trace a particular trait back through several generations of her ancestors.

H3.text: Punnett square is the type of display that will best help the researcher organize information when tracing a particular trait back through several generations of her ancestors in a family genetics project.

A4.text: A pedigree chart is a diagram that shows the occurrence of certain traits through different generations of a family, most commonly for humans, show dogs, and race horses.

A5.text: Analysis of the pedigree using the principles of Mendelian inheritance can determine whether a trait has a dominant or recessive pattern of inheritance.
